title: How I feel about minion block and unit collision.
body:
https://media2.giphy.com/media/ikkPzIyEEhsNW/200.gif
Half the time they're my freaking minions blocking me! The worst part is it seems almost malicious.

EDIT: Well I'm glad that so many people are with me on this! :D Just wanted to say the other day I had more terrible minion related experiences! For instance.. when I was trying to walk through a minion wall.. (Im pretty sure that they were minions. I believe i was playing galio in the mid lane as well so it could be that he has a big model idk) But he wouldn't even attempt to move repathing and such... instead he got stuck solid and me trying not to blow my flash(because it was a silly reason to do so) sees a xin coming in for a gank..I tried with all my might to get free... alas.. I had to flash.. but xin... I couldnt escape the xin all because of those minions of malicious intent! Please, I know that this thread is relatively old(five months) but please continue to share your experiences! :) Until then, maybe I'll see you on the rift! ^_^

Run through your minion wave and watch how your opponent gets horribly blocked.
Well, it works both ways.

Except it also means an even greater emphasis on ability creep.  People with mobility already have a significant advantage in many situations, making that advantage greater probably isn't good for the health of the game.  Someone with mobility can chase you through your creeps, but you wouldn't be able to chase them through their creeps if you lack mobility.

Basically, imagine if EVERYONE had an Azir wall.  Then only people who can get past the wall remain viable.
Until you find out you're opponent is the one and only Glorious Emperor {{champion:268}}

Get phantom dancer, no matter what.
Playing Graves? Phantom Dancer.
Playing Sejuani? Phantom Dancer.
Playing Orianna? Phantom Dancer.
You're welcome.
Or play Hecarim
Or Fizz.
And build phantom dancer on them.
Nobody messes with my {{item:3046}} {{champion:105}} power. Do you even lift?
Or Kassadin

I main Fizz :(. But suprisingly enough im not a huge jerk or anything. Sure im a jerk sometimes but im not like what alot of people say fizz people are. In fact alot of people that play fizz   are not bug"fu** yous" they are pretty nice. But yeah the unit collision seems it was built for fizzs passive.

As a fellow Fizz main, you don't need to point out that you're not a jerk. Let your normal conversation show that. Otherwise it makes you seem kinda self-conscious about your main, which you should never be. There are mains of literally every champion in this game (and according to the boards, there are a ton of cancerous champions, not just Fizz), so don't worry about the stereotypes if they don't affect you. 

Though, after having played Fizz and played against him plenty of times, let me tell you: he does feel like a big "fuck you." He's a mostly balanced "Fuck you" but a "Fuck you" nonetheless.

Unit collision is, or at least was, a major barrier to melee lane bullies like {{champion:122}} and {{champion:86}}, so that they wouldn't be able to just rush you directly and auto-win every trade. However, now that counterplay's been made a lot more explicit and that unit collision's been devalued by a ton of different effects (dashes, mainly, but also many different unit collision removal effects that are now pretty much a staple on every melee champion without a dash), I don't really see what the mechanic contributes.
It would mean Fizz would get a new passive and they'd have to give Phantom Dancer something unique.

When you can stick it inside of people, you have potentially much greater stick power, so it's mostly to balance melees by keeping them at a set distance and forcing them to walk around waves.

Imagine how hard it would be to escape your average Udyr if you couldn't run behind your own minions and force him to walk around them as they aggro'ed.

> Imagine how hard it would be to escape your average Udyr if you couldn't run behind your own minions and force him to walk around them as they aggro'ed

You do know that Udyr can just run through the minion wave as I would assume he would use his E (bear stance) while chasing you and the active effect of bear stances enables Udyr to ignore unit collision... so yeah...
It only lasts for 2-3 seconds (often not fully upgraded until at least Lv 11), while the base CD is 6, so it's still a valid strategy.

it only takes 2 minions to trap u between ur turret and the wall.

Your team is like "why didn't u retreat with us?"

If there is minion block there should be champion block!

I have been killed a number of times because a melee stacked atop me and I could not use any of my skill shot abilities because they start in front of the champ, not from the center. Also it would make tank blocking a thing.
There is a champion block. Most champions aside from a few like Fizz and Hecarim have a space that they occupy and blocks other units from passing through it via regular movement.
Its pretty rare to see a team actually stand in a formation to create a wall or trap the enemy in a corner.  Flash OP
yaaa ive trapped people against a wall with master YI before... and VI.    My question is... if Janna can walk through units... can units walk through Janna?

No. It's a one way thing. Units can't move through Janna but she can go through them.

Basically the other unit will spazz out while Janna ghosts through them. Try it with any champion that ignores collision or use {{summoner:6}}
What bothers me most is when I'm csing, and a minion sidesteps _just_ in time to prevent me from getting in range of a minion I need to kill.
Yes! and then it causes a chain reaction of losing farm!? XD
I've long thought that pretty silly, especially when big {{champion:31}} is tiptoeing around enemy minions.

That's because secretly they're playing gentleman cho.. and he's all like "excuse me Mr. cannon.. pardon me ms. caster... please part the great wall of melee minions gentleman cho coming through" Maybe the other champs need to learn to be more courteous and friendly like {{champion:31}} . It is funny though because he seems to have no problem getting around them.

I have seen many long range skillshot champions use minion collision to their advantage.  Especially in ARAM, if you see the enemy team is to one side, and a wave is on the way... you have a free shot with your line-nuke, because they will be unable to move out of the way.

So, there is gameplay use to them.

And of course I love using Janna, because knowing I am immune to collision lets me escape when being chased very often.

I do however hate ADCs, because phantom dancer is a thing.  I wish there was an AP equivalent, but AP lose out on many movement enhancing passives.
They are a bunch of little bastards alright, can't keep your eyes off of them or they'll screw you over. XD
